encryption_info.description: Cryptographic protocol and cipher suite used for encrypted communication, if available. E.g. TLSv1.2 (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256).

tcp_opt_sack_requested.description: Flag if TCP SACK (Selective Acknowledgement) is enabled/requested.

requested_num_streams_download.description: The requested number of streams for the download measurement.

agent_interface_download_measurement_tra.description: Contains information about bytes transferred during the download measurement, as reported by the measurement agent's interface, if available. Only used for displaying to the measurement agent.

actual_num_streams_upload.description: The actual number of streams used by the upload measurement.

actual_num_streams_download.description: The actual number of streams used by the download measurement.

encrypted.description: Indicates if the communication with the measurement server will be encrypted.

agent_interface_upload_measurement_traff.description: Contains information about bytes transferred during the upload measurement, as reported by the measurement agent's interface, if available. Only used for displaying to the measurement agent.

server_mss.description: Maximum Segment Size (MSS) value from the server-side.

address.description: The address of the measurement server.

tcp_opt_wscale_requested.description: Flag if the TCP window scale options are requested.

frame_count_including_slow_start.description: Number of frames sent over the WebSocket protocol during measurement including slow-start phase.

overhead.description: The overhead sent during the communication via the WebSocket protocol excluding slow-start phase.

frame_size.description: Size of a transmitted frame over the WebSocket protocol.

overhead_per_frame.description: The protocol overhead of a single WebSocket frame.

overhead_including_slow_start.description: The overhead sent during the communication via the WebSocket protocol including slow-start phase.

frame_count.description: Number of frames sent over the WebSocket protocol during measurement excluding slow-start phase.

web_socket_info_download.description: This class contains additional information gathered from the WebSocket protocol during the download measurement.

server_mtu.description: Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) value from the server-side.

agent_interface_total_traffic.description: Contains information about total bytes transferred during the speed measurement, as reported by the measurement agent's interface, if available. Only used for displaying to the measurement agent.

web_socket_info_upload.description: This class contains additional information gathered from the WebSocket protocol during the upload measurement.

requested_num_streams_upload.description: The requested number of streams for the upload measurement.

role.description: A set of roles for the identified registry entry.

uri.description: The unique name of a Task.

function.description: A list of entries in a registry identifying functions.

program.description: The (local) program to invoke in order to execute the Task. If this leaf is not set, then the system will try to identify a suitable program based on the registry information present.

tag.description: A set of Task-specific tags that are reported together with the measurement results to a Collector. A tag can be used, for example, to carry the Measurement Cycle ID.

name.description: The unique name of a Task.

measurement-parameters.description: The additional measurement parameters of the option.

id.description: An identifier uniquely identifying an option. This identifier is required by YANG to uniquely identify a name/value pair, but it otherwise has no semantic value.

name.description: The name of the option.

measurement_server.description: The measurement server that should be used, or the first measurement server that should be requested when load balancing.

javascript_measurement_code_url.description: URL to the measurement code. Overrides the measurement agent's implementation if set.

upload_slow_start.description: Value for the upload slow-start phase.

download_slow_start.description: Value for the download slow-start phase.

durations.description: Durations for each phase of the measurement.

upload_slow_start.description: Value for the upload slow-start phase.

download_slow_start.description: Value for the download slow-start phase.

flows.description: Number of (TCP) flows for each phase of the measurement.

rtt_count.description: Number of RTT packets that should be send in the RTT measurement.

agent_public_ip_country_code.description: Country of the measurement agent which is gathered by Geo-IP lookup.

network_country.description: The network operator country code (e.g. "AT"), if available.

public_ip_rdns.description: Reverse DNS for the public IP address.

sim_operator_mcc_mnc.description: The MCC/MNC of the SIM operator, if available.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

agent_public_ip.description: Public IP address of the measurement agent.

sim_country.description: The SIM operator country code (e.g. "AT"), if available.

network_operator_mcc_mnc.description: The MCC/MNC of the network operator, if available.

network_type_id.description: Network type id as it gets returned by the Android API.

public_ip_asn.description: ASN for the public IP address.

network_operator_name.description: The network operator name, if available.

provider_short_name.description: The short name (or shortcut) of the provider.

country_code_asn.description: Country code derived from the AS (e.g. "AT").

time.description: Time and date the signal information was captured (UTC).

network_point_in_time_info.description: Contains all relevant network information of a single point in time.

lte_rssnr_db.description: The LTE reference signal signal-to-noise ratio, in dB (If available).

lte_rsrp_dbm.description: The LTE reference signal received power, in dBm (If available).

lte_cqi.description: The LTE channel quality indicator (If available).

lte_rsrp_db.description: The LTE reference signal received quality, in dB (If available).

network_type_id.description: Network type id as it gets returned by the Android API.

wifi_rssi_dbm.description: The received signal strength indicator of the current 802.11 network, in dBm (If available).

signal_strength_2g3g_dbm.description: The received signal strength of 2G or 3G connections, in dBm (If available).

time.description: Time and date the signal information was captured (UTC).

wifi_link_speed_bps.description: The current WiFi link speed, in bits per second (If available).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

area_code.description: Contains the area code (e.g. location area code (GSM), tracking area code (LTE)), if available.

longitude.description: Geographic location longitude of this cell.

latitude.description: Geographic location latitude of this cell.

time.description: Time and date the cell location information was captured (UTC).

primary_scrambling_code.description: Contains the primary scrambling code, if available.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

arfcn.description: Contains the ARFCN (Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number) (e.g. 16-bit GSM ARFCN or 18-bit LTE EARFCN), if available.

measurement-parameters.description: The additional measurement parameters of the option.

id.description: An identifier uniquely identifying an option. This identifier is required by YANG to uniquely identify a name/value pair, but it otherwise has no semantic value.

name.description: The name of the option.

icon_character.description: The icon to be used for the given group (as a single char in the corresponding icon font).

value.description: The actual value of this item in the given unit.

key.description: The key is the path to the chosen field inside the data model, e.g. "device_info.model".

title.description: The translated title of this item.

items.description: Contains all the entries of the given group.

description.description: The already translated (optional) description of the given group.

title.description: The already translated title of the given group.

end_time.description: End Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

open_data_uuid.description: The open-data identifier (UUIDv4) of the measurement.

overlaps.description: Number of executions prevented due to overlaps with a previous invocation of this Schedule.

last-invocation.description: The date and time of the last invocation of this Schedule.

suppression-tag.description: A set of Suppression tags that are used to select Schedules to be suppressed.

suppressions.description: Number of suppressed executions of this Schedule.

storage.description: The amount of secondary storage (e.g., allocated in a file system) holding temporary data allocated to the Schedule in bytes.  This object reports the amount of allocated physical storage and not the storage used by logical data records.

stop.description: This choice contains optional leafs that control the graceful forced termination of scheduled Actions. When the end has been reached, the scheduled Actions should be forced to terminate the measurements. This may involve being active some additional time in order to properly finish the Action's activity (e.g., waiting for any messages that are still outstanding). If set to a LmapStopDurationDto it will behave like a typical timeout set for the execution of this schedule.

invocations.description: Number of invocations of this Schedule. This counter does not include suppressed invocations or invocations that were prevented due to an overlap with a previous invocation of this Schedule.

start.description: The event source controlling the start of the scheduled Actions. Referencing the LmapEventDto.name of an Action.

state.description: The current state of the Schedule (One of: enabled, disabled, running, suppressed).

tag.description: A set of Schedule-specific tags that are reported together with the measurement results to a Collector.

execution-mode.description: The execution mode of this Schedule determines in which order the Actions of the Schedule are executed. Supported values are: sequential, pipelined, parallel.

overlaps.description: Number of executions prevented due to overlaps with a previous invocation of this Action.

last-invocation.description: The date and time of the last invocation of this Action.

task.description: The Task invoked by this Action.

last-status.description: The status code returned by the last execution of this Action (with 0 indicating successful execution).

name.description: The unique identifier for this Action.

parameters.description: This container is a placeholder for runtime parameters defined in Task-specific data models augmenting the base LMAP report data model.

last-failed-message.description: The status message produced by the last failed execution of this Action.

suppressions.description: Number of suppressed executions of this Action.

destination.description: A set of Schedules receiving the output produced by this Action. The output is stored temporarily since the Destination Schedules will in general not be running when output is passed to them. The behavior of an Action passing data to its own Schedule is implementation specific.

storage.description: The amount of secondary storage (e.g., allocated in a file system) holding temporary data allocated to the Schedule in bytes.  This object reports the amount of allocated physical storage and not the storage used by logical data records.

invocations.description: Number of invocations of this Action. This counter does not include suppressed invocations or invocations that were prevented due to an overlap with a previous invocation of this Action.

suppression-tag.description: A set of Suppression tags that are used to select Actions to be suppressed.

state.description: The current state of the Action (One of: enabled, disabled, running, suppressed).

tag.description: A set of Action-specific tags that are reported together with the measurement results to a Collector.

failures.description: Number of failed executions of this Action.

last-failed-completion.description: The date and time of the last failed completion of this Action.

last-failed-status.description: The status code returned by the last failed execution of this Action.

last-completion.description: The date and time of the last completion of this Action.

last-message.description: The status message produced by the last execution of this Action.

measurement-parameters.description: The additional measurement parameters of the option.

id.description: An identifier uniquely identifying an option. This identifier is required by YANG to uniquely identify a name/value pair, but it otherwise has no semantic value.

name.description: The name of the option.

option.description: The list of Action-specific options that are appended to the list of Task-specific options.

action.description: An Action describes a Task that is invoked by the Schedule. Multiple Actions are invoked according to the execution-mode of the Schedule.

failures.description: Number of failed executions of this Schedule. A failed execution is an execution where at least one Action failed.

name.description: The locally unique, administratively assigned name for this Schedule.

test_counter.description: The test counter stored on the measurement agent (how many measurement have already been executed).

protocol_version.description: The version of the measurement protocol.

library_version.description: The version of the measurement library.

ip_version.description: The measurement agent's public IP version (IPv4 or IPv6).

ip_address.description: The measurement agent's public IP address.

destination.description: A set of Schedules receiving the output produced by this Action. The output is stored temporarily since the Destination Schedules will in general not be running when output is passed to them. The behavior of an Action passing data to its own Schedule is implementation specific.

measurement-parameters.description: The additional measurement parameters of the option.

id.description: An identifier uniquely identifying an option. This identifier is required by YANG to uniquely identify a name/value pair, but it otherwise has no semantic value.

name.description: The name of the option.

option.description: The list of Action-specific options that are appended to the list of Task-specific options.

relative_start_time_ns.description: Start time in nanoseconds relative to the start time of the overall measurement object.

version_library.description: The library version this measurement used, if available.

start_time.description: Start Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

evaluation_keys.description: Contains all evaluated result keys mapped to their respective results.

description.description: The already translated (and evaluated) description for this QoS measurement.

failure_count.description: The number of failed QoS objective evaluations (= evaluationCount - successCount).

summary.description: The already translated summary for this QoS measurement.

success_count.description: The number of successful QoS objective evaluations.

implausible.description: Flag to mark this QoS measurement as implausible. An implausible QoS result is one that could not have been measured that way. This flag exists for potentially tampered results, so they do not count as valid results (e.g. to prevent tampering w/statistics).

evaluation_count.description: The number of QoS objective evaluations that were run.

type.description: The specific QoS type (e.g. TCP, UDC)

results.description: This DTO class contains a single evaluated QoS objective.

relative_end_time_ns.description: End time in nanoseconds relative to the end time of the overall measurement object.

reason.description: The reason why a measurement failed.

end_time.description: End Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

implausible.description: Flag to mark this QoS measurement as implausible. An implausible QoS result is one that could not have been measured that way. This flag exists for potentially tampered results, so they do not count as valid results (e.g. to prevent tampering w/statistics).

version_protocol.description: The protocol version this measurement used, if available.

random-spread.description: This optional leaf adds a random spread to the computation of the event's trigger time. The random spread is a uniformly distributed random number taken from the interval [0:random-spread].

name.description: The unique name of an event source, used when referencing this event.

cycle-interval.description: The optional cycle-interval defines the duration of the time interval in seconds that is used to calculate cycle numbers. No cycle number is calculated if the optional cycle-interval does not exist.

type.description: Type identifier of the given event.

event-type.description: Different types of events are handled by different branches of this choice. Note that this choice can be extended via augmentations.

type.description: Type identifier of the given event.

name.description: The translated QoS type name.

qos_type_info.description: Map of QoS measurement types to translated type information.

website.description: Base URL of the web site of the form "[protocol]://[domain]:[port]/[path]".

collector_service.description: Base URL of the collector service of the form "[protocol]://[domain]:[port]/[path]". This domain name should have A and AAAA records.

map_service.description: Base URL of the map service of the form "[protocol]://[domain]:[port]/[path]".

statistic_service.description: Base URL of the statistic service of the form "[protocol]://[domain]:[port]/[path]".

controller_service_ipv4.description: IPv4-only base URL of the controller service. This domain name must only have an A record.

controller_service_ipv6.description: IPv6-only base URL of the controller service. This domain name must only have an AAAA record.

controller_service.description: Base URL of the controller service of the form "[protocol]://[domain]:[port]/[path]". This domain name should have A and AAAA records.

urls.description: Object that contains base URLs for controller, collector, map and statistic services.

versions.description: Class for all kind of versions that the server reveals.

settings.description: The settings response object sent to the measurement agent.

frame_count_including_slow_start.description: Number of frames sent over the WebSocket protocol during measurement including slow-start phase.

overhead.description: The overhead sent during the communication via the WebSocket protocol excluding slow-start phase.

frame_size.description: Size of a transmitted frame over the WebSocket protocol.

overhead_per_frame.description: The protocol overhead of a single WebSocket frame.

overhead_including_slow_start.description: The overhead sent during the communication via the WebSocket protocol including slow-start phase.

frame_count.description: Number of frames sent over the WebSocket protocol during measurement excluding slow-start phase.

status.description: Status code for the error. Example: 400, 404, 500, ...

trace.description: Exception stack tracewhich is only added if the service runs in development mode.

time.description: Date and time at which the error occurred.

error.description: String representation of the status. Example: "Internal Server Error, "Not Found", ...

path.description: URI path/resource that caused the error.

message.description: The error or exception message. Example: "java.lang.RuntimeException".

errors.description: Optional list of errors that occurred during request processing.

data.description: Actual data that is returned for the request/response.

rtt_ns.description: Round trip time recorded in nanoseconds.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

type.description: Type identifier of the given event.

start_time.description: Start time of this sub measurement in UTC.

objective_count.description: Indicated how many objective where run during the QoS measurement.

end.description: The event source controlling the end of the Suppression period. If not present, Suppression continues indefinitely. Referencing the LmapEventDto.name of an Action.

name.description: The locally unique, administratively assigned name for this Suppression.

start.description: The event source controlling the start of the Suppression period. Referencing the LmapEventDto.name of an Action.

state.description: The current state of the Suppression.

stop-running.description: If 'stop-running' is true, running Schedules and Actions matching the Suppression will be terminated when Suppression is activated. If 'stop-running' is false, running Schedules and Actions will not be affected if Suppression is activated.

match.description: A set of Suppression match patterns. The Suppression will apply to all Schedules (and their Actions) that have a matching value in their suppression-tags and to all Actions that have a matching value in their suppression-tags.

objectives.description: QoS objectives that should be executed by the measurement agent.

test_counter.description: The test counter stored on the measurement agent (how many measurement have already been executed).

protocol_version.description: The version of the measurement protocol.

library_version.description: The version of the measurement library.

data.description: Actual data that is returned for the request/response.

start_time.description: Start time of this sub measurement in UTC.

measurements.description: Map that contains available information for each measurement type (Speed, QoS). If map misses speed then no speed measurement was done, likewise for QoS, ...

duration_ns.description: Overall duration of all sub measurements.

avg_mem_usage.description: Average Memory usage during the measurement.

avg_cpu_usage.description: Average CPU usage during the measurement.

device_full_name.description: The device name that is commonly known to users (e.g. Google Pixel).

device_info.description: BriefDeviceInfo contains the most important values from DeviceInfo class.

time.description: Time and date the geographic location information was captured (UTC).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to measurement begin).

first_accurate_geo_location.description: The first accurate GeoLocation i.e. the location where the measurement was started.

uuid.description: The UUIDv4 identifier of the measurement object.

rtt_ns.description: Round trip time recorded in nanoseconds.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

num_received.description: The actual number of received RTT packets.

num_sent.description: The actual number of sent RTT packets.

requested_num_packets.description: The number of RTT packets to send, as instructed by the server.

num_missing.description: The actual number of missing RTT packets.

packet_size.description: The actual size of RTT packets.

num_error.description: The actual number of failed RTT packets.

language.description: Language specified by the measurement agent.

agent_uuid.description: The agent's UUID. This value is ignored if the resource path already contains the agent's UUID.

time.description: Time and date the geographic location information was captured (UTC).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to measurement begin).

geo_location.description: The measurement agent device location at the time the request was sent or null if the measurement agent doesn't have location information.

timezone.description: The measurement agent's time zone. Is only stored if a measurement is sent to the server.

api_level.description: API level of operating system or SDK (e.g. Android API level or Swift SDK version).

stream_id.description: The stream id (numeric value starting from 0).

bytes.description: Bytes transmitted or received since start of the speed measurement.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time since start of the speed measurement.

status.description: Status code for the error. Example: 400, 404, 500, ...

trace.description: Exception stack tracewhich is only added if the service runs in development mode.

time.description: Date and time at which the error occurred.

error.description: String representation of the status. Example: "Internal Server Error, "Not Found", ...

path.description: URI path/resource that caused the error.

message.description: The error or exception message. Example: "java.lang.RuntimeException".

area_code.description: Contains the area code (e.g. location area code (GSM), tracking area code (LTE)), if available.

longitude.description: Geographic location longitude of this cell.

latitude.description: Geographic location latitude of this cell.

time.description: Time and date the cell location information was captured (UTC).

primary_scrambling_code.description: Contains the primary scrambling code, if available.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

arfcn.description: Contains the ARFCN (Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number) (e.g. 16-bit GSM ARFCN or 18-bit LTE EARFCN), if available.

icon_character.description: The icon to be used for the given group (as a single char in the corresponding icon font).

value.description: The actual value of this item in the given unit.

key.description: The key is the path to the chosen field inside the data model, e.g. "device_info.model".

title.description: The translated title of this item.

items.description: Contains all the entries of the given group.

description.description: The already translated (optional) description of the given group.

title.description: The already translated title of the given group.

duration.description: The duration controlling the graceful forced termination of the scheduled Actions, in ms.

throughput_avg_download_bps.description: The calculated (average) download throughput in bits per second.

start_time.description: Start time of this sub measurement in UTC.

throughput_avg_upload_bps.description: The calculated (average) upload throughput in bits per second.

start_time.description: Start time of this sub measurement in UTC.

relative_start_time_ns.description: Start time in nanoseconds relative to the start time of the overall measurement object.

version_library.description: The library version this measurement used, if available.

start_time.description: Start Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

relative_end_time_ns.description: End time in nanoseconds relative to the end time of the overall measurement object.

reason.description: The reason why a measurement failed.

end_time.description: End Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

implausible.description: Flag to mark this QoS measurement as implausible. An implausible QoS result is one that could not have been measured that way. This flag exists for potentially tampered results, so they do not count as valid results (e.g. to prevent tampering w/statistics).

version_protocol.description: The protocol version this measurement used, if available.

rtt_ns.description: Round trip time recorded in nanoseconds.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

num_received.description: The actual number of received RTT packets.

median_log.description: Common logarithm of the median RTT.

num_sent.description: The actual number of sent RTT packets.

max_log.description: Common logarithm of the maximum (worst) RTT.

requested_num_packets.description: The number of RTT packets to send, as instructed by the server.

standard_deviation_ns.description: Calculated RTT standard deviation in nanoseconds.

min_log.description: Common logarithm of the minimum (best) RTT.

num_missing.description: The actual number of missing RTT packets.

packet_size.description: The actual size of RTT packets.

num_error.description: The actual number of failed RTT packets.

average_log.description: Common logarithm of the average RTT.

role.description: A set of roles for the identified registry entry.

uri.description: The unique name of a Task.

function.description: A list of entries in a registry identifying functions.

program.description: The (local) program to invoke in order to execute the Task. If this leaf is not set, then the system will try to identify a suitable program based on the registry information present.

name.description: The unique name of a Task capability. Refers to the LmapTaskDto.name and needs be the exact same in order to match.

version.description: A short description of the software implementing the Task. This should include the version number of the Measurement Task software.

tasks.description: A list of Tasks that the Measurement Agent supports.

version.description: A short description of the software implementing the Measurement Agent. This should include the version number of the Measurement Agent software.

tag.description: An optional unordered set of tags that provide additional information about the capabilities of the Measurement Agent.

lte_rssnr_db.description: The LTE reference signal signal-to-noise ratio, in dB (If available).

lte_rsrp_dbm.description: The LTE reference signal received power, in dBm (If available).

lte_cqi.description: The LTE channel quality indicator (If available).

lte_rsrp_db.description: The LTE reference signal received quality, in dB (If available).

network_type_id.description: Network type id as it gets returned by the Android API.

wifi_rssi_dbm.description: The received signal strength indicator of the current 802.11 network, in dBm (If available).

signal_strength_2g3g_dbm.description: The received signal strength of 2G or 3G connections, in dBm (If available).

time.description: Time and date the signal information was captured (UTC).

wifi_link_speed_bps.description: The current WiFi link speed, in bits per second (If available).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

measurement-point.description: The measurement point indicating where the Measurement Agent is located on a path.

last-started.description: The date and time the Measurement Agent last started (i.e. the date to the previous execution of the measurement agent before the current one).

report-agent-id.description: The 'report-agent-id' controls whether the 'agent-id' is reported to Collectors. Set to true if anonymized results are desired.

group-id.description: The group-id identifies a group of Measurement Agents. In certain deployments, the group-id may be considered less sensitive than the agent-id.

agent-id.description: The agent-id identifies a Measurement Agent with a very low probability of collision (i.e. a UUID v4). In certain deployments, the agent-id may be considered sensitive, and hence this object is optional.

controller-timeout.description: A timer is started after each successful contact with a Controller. When the timer reaches the controller-timeout, an event (controller-lost) is raised indicating that connectivity to the Controller has been lost.

report-measurement-point.description: The 'report-measurement-point' controls whether the 'measurement-point' is reported to Collectors.

report-group-id.description: The 'report-group-id' controls whether the 'group-id' is reported to Collectors.

terms_and_conditions_accepted_version.description: The version of the presented terms and conditions that the measurement agent agreed to (or declined).

terms_and_conditions_accepted.description: Boolean whether the measurement agent has accepted the presented terms and conditions.

value.description: The actual value of this item in the given unit.

key.description: The key is the path to the chosen field inside the data model, e.g. "device_info.model".

title.description: The translated title of this item.

throughput_avg_download_bps.description: The calculated (average) download throughput in bits per second.

throughput_avg_download_log.description: Common logarithm of the (average) download throughput.

bytes_download.description: Bytes received during the speed measurement (Download).

relative_start_time_download_ns.description: Relative start time of the download measurement in nanoseconds.

relative_start_time_rtt_ns.description: Relative start time of the RTT measurement in nanoseconds.

requested_duration_download_ns.description: The nominal measurement duration of the download measurement.

rtt_ns.description: Round trip time recorded in nanoseconds.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to test begin).

num_received.description: The actual number of received RTT packets.

median_log.description: Common logarithm of the median RTT.

num_sent.description: The actual number of sent RTT packets.

max_log.description: Common logarithm of the maximum (worst) RTT.

requested_num_packets.description: The number of RTT packets to send, as instructed by the server.

standard_deviation_ns.description: Calculated RTT standard deviation in nanoseconds.

min_log.description: Common logarithm of the minimum (best) RTT.

num_missing.description: The actual number of missing RTT packets.

packet_size.description: The actual size of RTT packets.

num_error.description: The actual number of failed RTT packets.

average_log.description: Common logarithm of the average RTT.

rtt_info.description: Contains round trip time information measured during the measurement.

relative_end_time_ns.description: End time in nanoseconds relative to the end time of the overall measurement object.

stream_id.description: The stream id (numeric value starting from 0).

bytes.description: Bytes transmitted or received since start of the speed measurement.

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time since start of the speed measurement.

download_raw_data.description: Contains a list of all captured byte transfers during the download speed measurement.

bytes_upload_including_slow_start.description: Bytes transferred during the speed measurement (Upload) with slow-start phase.

version_library.description: The library version this measurement used, if available.

throughput_avg_upload_log.description: Common logarithm of the average upload throughput.

encryption_info.description: Cryptographic protocol and cipher suite used for encrypted communication, if available. E.g. TLSv1.2 (TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256).

tcp_opt_sack_requested.description: Flag if TCP SACK (Selective Acknowledgement) is enabled/requested.

requested_num_streams_download.description: The requested number of streams for the download measurement.

agent_interface_download_measurement_tra.description: Contains information about bytes transferred during the download measurement, as reported by the measurement agent's interface, if available. Only used for displaying to the measurement agent.

actual_num_streams_upload.description: The actual number of streams used by the upload measurement.

actual_num_streams_download.description: The actual number of streams used by the download measurement.

encrypted.description: Indicates if the communication with the measurement server will be encrypted.

agent_interface_upload_measurement_traff.description: Contains information about bytes transferred during the upload measurement, as reported by the measurement agent's interface, if available. Only used for displaying to the measurement agent.

server_mss.description: Maximum Segment Size (MSS) value from the server-side.

address.description: The address of the measurement server.

tcp_opt_wscale_requested.description: Flag if the TCP window scale options are requested.

frame_count_including_slow_start.description: Number of frames sent over the WebSocket protocol during measurement including slow-start phase.

overhead.description: The overhead sent during the communication via the WebSocket protocol excluding slow-start phase.

frame_size.description: Size of a transmitted frame over the WebSocket protocol.

overhead_per_frame.description: The protocol overhead of a single WebSocket frame.

overhead_including_slow_start.description: The overhead sent during the communication via the WebSocket protocol including slow-start phase.

frame_count.description: Number of frames sent over the WebSocket protocol during measurement excluding slow-start phase.

web_socket_info_download.description: This class contains additional information gathered from the WebSocket protocol during the download measurement.

server_mtu.description: Maximum Transmission Unit (MTU) value from the server-side.

agent_interface_total_traffic.description: Contains information about total bytes transferred during the speed measurement, as reported by the measurement agent's interface, if available. Only used for displaying to the measurement agent.

web_socket_info_upload.description: This class contains additional information gathered from the WebSocket protocol during the upload measurement.

requested_num_streams_upload.description: The requested number of streams for the upload measurement.

connection_info.description: Contains information about the connection(s) used for the speed measurement.

requested_duration_upload_ns.description: The nominal measurement duration of the upload measurement.

start_time.description: Start Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

throughput_avg_upload_bps.description: The calculated (average) upload throughput in bits per second.

reason.description: The reason why a measurement failed.

implausible.description: Flag to mark this QoS measurement as implausible. An implausible QoS result is one that could not have been measured that way. This flag exists for potentially tampered results, so they do not count as valid results (e.g. to prevent tampering w/statistics).

relative_start_time_ns.description: Start time in nanoseconds relative to the start time of the overall measurement object.

bytes_download_including_slow_start.description: Bytes received during the speed measurement (Download) with slow-start phase.

bytes_upload.description: Bytes transferred during the speed measurement (Upload).

upload_raw_data.description: Contains a list of all captured byte transfers during the upload speed measurement.

end_time.description: End Date and time for this sub measurement. Date and time is always stored as UTC.

version_protocol.description: The protocol version this measurement used, if available.

relative_start_time_upload_ns.description: Relative start time of the upload measurement in nanoseconds.

value.description: The value recorded at this point in time.

relative_time_ns.description: The relative time in nanoseconds to the measurement start.

end.description: The event source controlling the graceful forced termination of the scheduled Actions.

role.description: A set of roles for the identified registry entry.

uri.description: The unique name of a Task.

function.description: A list of entries in a registry identifying functions.

program.description: The (local) program to invoke in order to execute the Task. If this leaf is not set, then the system will try to identify a suitable program based on the registry information present.

name.description: The unique name of a Task capability. Refers to the LmapTaskDto.name and needs be the exact same in order to match.

version.description: A short description of the software implementing the Task. This should include the version number of the Measurement Task software.

test_counter.description: The test counter stored on the measurement agent (how many measurement have already been executed).

protocol_version.description: The version of the measurement protocol.

library_version.description: The version of the measurement library.

language.description: Language specified by the measurement agent.

agent_uuid.description: The agent's UUID. This value is ignored if the resource path already contains the agent's UUID.

time.description: Time and date the geographic location information was captured (UTC).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to measurement begin).

geo_location.description: The measurement agent device location at the time the request was sent or null if the measurement agent doesn't have location information.

timezone.description: The measurement agent's time zone. Is only stored if a measurement is sent to the server.

api_level.description: API level of operating system or SDK (e.g. Android API level or Swift SDK version).

request_info.description: Additional information that is sent by measurement agent alongside the request.

data.description: Actual data that is returned for the request/response.

time.description: Time and date the geographic location information was captured (UTC).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to measurement begin).

evaluation_keys.description: Contains all evaluated result keys mapped to their respective results.

description.description: The already translated (and evaluated) description for this QoS measurement.

failure_count.description: The number of failed QoS objective evaluations (= evaluationCount - successCount).

summary.description: The already translated summary for this QoS measurement.

success_count.description: The number of successful QoS objective evaluations.

implausible.description: Flag to mark this QoS measurement as implausible. An implausible QoS result is one that could not have been measured that way. This flag exists for potentially tampered results, so they do not count as valid results (e.g. to prevent tampering w/statistics).

evaluation_count.description: The number of QoS objective evaluations that were run.

type.description: The specific QoS type (e.g. TCP, UDC)

function.description: A list of entries in a registry identifying functions.

program.description: The (local) program to invoke in order to execute the Task. If this leaf is not set, then the system will try to identify a suitable program based on the registry information present.

tag.description: A set of Task-specific tags that are reported together with the measurement results to a Collector. A tag can be used, for example, to carry the Measurement Cycle ID.

name.description: The unique name of a Task.

measurement-parameters.description: The additional measurement parameters of the option.

id.description: An identifier uniquely identifying an option. This identifier is required by YANG to uniquely identify a name/value pair, but it otherwise has no semantic value.

name.description: The name of the option.

end.description: The event source controlling the end of the Suppression period. If not present, Suppression continues indefinitely. Referencing the LmapEventDto.name of an Action.

name.description: The locally unique, administratively assigned name for this Suppression.

start.description: The event source controlling the start of the Suppression period. Referencing the LmapEventDto.name of an Action.

state.description: The current state of the Suppression.

stop-running.description: If 'stop-running' is true, running Schedules and Actions matching the Suppression will be terminated when Suppression is activated. If 'stop-running' is false, running Schedules and Actions will not be affected if Suppression is activated.

match.description: A set of Suppression match patterns. The Suppression will apply to all Schedules (and their Actions) that have a matching value in their suppression-tags and to all Actions that have a matching value in their suppression-tags.

suppressions.description: Suppression information to prevent Schedules or certain Actions from starting.

measurement-point.description: The measurement point indicating where the Measurement Agent is located on a path.

last-started.description: The date and time the Measurement Agent last started (i.e. the date to the previous execution of the measurement agent before the current one).

report-agent-id.description: The 'report-agent-id' controls whether the 'agent-id' is reported to Collectors. Set to true if anonymized results are desired.

group-id.description: The group-id identifies a group of Measurement Agents. In certain deployments, the group-id may be considered less sensitive than the agent-id.

agent-id.description: The agent-id identifies a Measurement Agent with a very low probability of collision (i.e. a UUID v4). In certain deployments, the agent-id may be considered sensitive, and hence this object is optional.

controller-timeout.description: A timer is started after each successful contact with a Controller. When the timer reaches the controller-timeout, an event (controller-lost) is raised indicating that connectivity to the Controller has been lost.

report-measurement-point.description: The 'report-measurement-point' controls whether the 'measurement-point' is reported to Collectors.

report-group-id.description: The 'report-group-id' controls whether the 'group-id' is reported to Collectors.

agent.description: Configuration of parameters affecting the whole Measurement Agent.

language.description: Language specified by the measurement agent.

agent_uuid.description: The agent's UUID. This value is ignored if the resource path already contains the agent's UUID.

time.description: Time and date the geographic location information was captured (UTC).

relative_time_ns.description: Relative time in nanoseconds (to measurement begin).

geo_location.description: The measurement agent device location at the time the request was sent or null if the measurement agent doesn't have location information.

timezone.description: The measurement agent's time zone. Is only stored if a measurement is sent to the server.

api_level.description: API level of operating system or SDK (e.g. Android API level or Swift SDK version).

additional-request-info.description: Additional information that is sent by client alongside the request. This contains most information from ClientInfo.

role.description: A set of roles for the identified registry entry.

uri.description: The unique name of a Task.

function.description: A list of entries in a registry identifying functions.

program.description: The (local) program to invoke in order to execute the Task. If this leaf is not set, then the system will try to identify a suitable program based on the registry information present.

name.description: The unique name of a Task capability. Refers to the LmapTaskDto.name and needs be the exact same in order to match.

version.description: A short description of the software implementing the Task. This should include the version number of the Measurement Task software.

tasks.description: A list of Tasks that the Measurement Agent supports.

version.description: A short description of the software implementing the Measurement Agent. This should include the version number of the Measurement Agent software.

tag.description: An optional unordered set of tags that provide additional information about the capabilities of the Measurement Agent.

capabilities.description: Agent capabilities including a list of supported Tasks.

overlaps.description: Number of executions prevented due to overlaps with a previous invocation of this Schedule.

last-invocation.description: The date and time of the last invocation of this Schedule.

suppression-tag.description: A set of Suppression tags that are used to select Schedules to be suppressed.

suppressions.description: Number of suppressed executions of this Schedule.

storage.description: The amount of secondary storage (e.g., allocated in a file system) holding temporary data allocated to the Schedule in bytes.  This object reports the amount of allocated physical storage and not the storage used by logical data records.

stop.description: This choice contains optional leafs that control the graceful forced termination of scheduled Actions. When the end has been reached, the scheduled Actions should be forced to terminate the measurements. This may involve being active some additional time in order to properly finish the Action's activity (e.g., waiting for any messages that are still outstanding). If set to a LmapStopDurationDto it will behave like a typical timeout set for the execution of this schedule.

invocations.description: Number of invocations of this Schedule. This counter does not include suppressed invocations or invocations that were prevented due to an overlap with a previous invocation of this Schedule.

start.description: The event source controlling the start of the scheduled Actions. Referencing the LmapEventDto.name of an Action.

state.description: The current state of the Schedule (One of: enabled, disabled, running, suppressed).

tag.description: A set of Schedule-specific tags that are reported together with the measurement results to a Collector.

execution-mode.description: The execution mode of this Schedule determines in which order the Actions of the Schedule are executed. Supported values are: sequential, pipelined, parallel.

overlaps.description: Number of executions prevented due to overlaps with a previous invocation of this Action.

last-invocation.description: The date and time of the last invocation of this Action.

task.description: The Task invoked by this Action.

last-status.description: The status code returned by the last execution of this Action (with 0 indicating successful execution).

name.description: The unique identifier for this Action.

parameters.description: This container is a placeholder for runtime parameters defined in Task-specific data models augmenting the base LMAP report data model.

last-failed-message.description: The status message produced by the last failed execution of this Action.

suppressions.description: Number of suppressed executions of this Action.

destination.description: A set of Schedules receiving the output produced by this Action. The output is stored temporarily since the Destination Schedules will in general not be running when output is passed to them. The behavior of an Action passing data to its own Schedule is implementation specific.

storage.description: The amount of secondary storage (e.g., allocated in a file system) holding temporary data allocated to the Schedule in bytes.  This object reports the amount of allocated physical storage and not the storage used by logical data records.

invocations.description: Number of invocations of this Action. This counter does not include suppressed invocations or invocations that were prevented due to an overlap with a previous invocation of this Action.

suppression-tag.description: A set of Suppression tags that are used to select Actions to be suppressed.

state.description: The current state of the Action (One of: enabled, disabled, running, suppressed).

tag.description: A set of Action-specific tags that are reported together with the measurement results to a Collector.

failures.description: Number of failed executions of this Action.

last-failed-completion.description: The date and time of the last failed completion of this Action.

last-failed-status.description: The status code returned by the last failed execution of this Action.

last-completion.description: The date and time of the last completion of this Action.

last-message.description: The status message produced by the last execution of this Action.

option.description: The list of Action-specific options that are appended to the list of Task-specific options.

action.description: An Action describes a Task that is invoked by the Schedule. Multiple Actions are invoked according to the execution-mode of the Schedule.

failures.description: Number of failed executions of this Schedule. A failed execution is an execution where at least one Action failed.

name.description: The locally unique, administratively assigned name for this Schedule.

schedules.description: Configuration of LMAP Schedules. Schedules control which Tasks are executed by the LMAP implementation.

random-spread.description: This optional leaf adds a random spread to the computation of the event's trigger time. The random spread is a uniformly distributed random number taken from the interval [0:random-spread].

name.description: The unique name of an event source, used when referencing this event.

cycle-interval.description: The optional cycle-interval defines the duration of the time interval in seconds that is used to calculate cycle numbers. No cycle number is calculated if the optional cycle-interval does not exist.

type.description: Type identifier of the given event.

event-type.description: Different types of events are handled by different branches of this choice. Note that this choice can be extended via augmentations.

events.description: Configuration of LMAP events. Implementations may be forced to delay acting upon the occurrence of events in the face of local constraints. An Action triggered by an event therefore should not rely on the accuracy provided by the scheduler implementation.

cpu_min.description: Minimum CPU usage, as double between 0 - 100.

name.description: Operating system name (e.g. Android or iOS).

cpu_max.description: Maximum CPU usage, as double between 0 - 100.

memory_median.description: Median Memory usage, as double between 0 - 100.

cpu_average.description: Average CPU usage, as double between 0 - 100.

memory_min.description: Minimum Memory usage, as double between 0 - 100.

memory_average.description: Average Memory usage, as double between 0 - 100.

memory_max.description: Maximum Memory usage, as double between 0 - 100.

api_level.description: API level of operating system or SDK (e.g. Android API level or Swift SDK version).

cpu_median.description: Median CPU usage, as double between 0 - 100.
